H0.text: Who in the Muslim faith proclaims the hours of prayer from a minaret. Imam

H1.text: Who in the Muslim faith proclaims the hours of prayer from a minaret. Muadhin

H2.text: Who in the Muslim faith proclaims the hours of prayer from a minaret. Qari

H3.text: Who in the Muslim faith proclaims the hours of prayer from a minaret. Muzim

A4.text: The muezzin (; Arabic: مُؤَذِّن, romanized: Muʾaḏḏin), also spelled mu'azzin, is the person who proclaims the call to the daily prayer (ṣalāt) five times a day at a mosque from the minaret.

A5.text: The first muezzin was a former slave Bilal ibn Rabah, one of the most trusted and loyal sahabah (companions) of the Islamic prophet Muhammad.

A6.text: Cairo to use computerised call to prayer after complaints over tuneless muezzin.

A7.text: Muslim preachers given call-to-prayer singing lessons.
